DOC.HEAD: Christmas Presents Stolen From Home of Serviceman's Wife
With AM-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Christmas presents and two television sets were stolen from the home of a woman whose serviceman husband is with the U.S. invasion force fighting in Panama. The home of Sgt. Greg Widberg and his wife, Rachel, was broken into sometime between 4 p.m. Thursday and 3:20 p.m. Friday, according to a report by the Cumberland County Sheriff's Department. A 25-inch color TV valued at $400 and a 13-inch black-and-white set valued at $50 were taken, as well as Christmas presents whose value was not known because they had not been opened, the report said. Mrs. Widberg was reached at a friend's house Monday but said she did not want to comment on the theft. Her uncle, Samuel George, said his niece is seven months pregnant and that her husband, a paratrooper with the 82nd Airborne based at Fort Bragg, is with U.S. forces in Panama.
